content:
I started this port for a potential future need but am running a bit stuck. Anyone who might be interested and able to get me unstuck? The AJAX form does not seem to be getting inserted so it can't be loaded when you click "Add comment" or "Reply", etc. (I'm planning to squash merge the port-cleanup branch once I get things functional)
https://github.com/laryn/ajax_comments/tree/port-cleanup

laryn/ajax_comments
Provides AJAX comments to Backdrop sites. Contribute to laryn/ajax_comments development by creating an account on GitHub.

I'm working on the Ajax Comments module (testing and help welcome). I'm looking for a tip here -- it's supposed to give focus to the textarea when clicking "Reply" but it isn't working with Backdrop's CKEditor (if I turn the comment field to plaintext, it works). Anybody have a pointer as to why? e.g. https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/ajax_comments/blob/1.x-1.x/ajax_comments.module#L726

backdrop-contrib/ajax_comments
Convert comment forms to Ajax. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/ajax_comments development by creating an account on GitHub.
@Laryn it seems that when CKEditor is enabled, the textarea is "replaced" by a .cke_wysiwyg_frame iframe, so ajax_command_invoke()will need to be updated to account for that.
